required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Voiding Function After Mid-Urethral Slings With and Without Local Anesthetic: Randomized Controlled Trial
clinical_study.official_title: Voiding Function After Mid-Urethral Slings With and Without Local Anesthetic: Randomized Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine if there is a difference in post-operative voiding function between subjects receiving local anesthetic and those receiving placebo at the time of mid-urethral sling placement. The secondary objective is to evaluate pain after the procedure in the two groups.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects Who Passed the Voiding Trial After a Midurethral Sling
primary_outcome.description: Study team assessment of whether the use of local anesthetic has any affect on the percentage of patients who pass their post-operative bladder challenge. This is determined by their voided volume and post-void residual.

secondary_outcome.measure: Post-operative Pain Scores at 2-3 Hours Post op
secondary_outcome.description: Visual analog score at 2 hours post op will be compared in the two groups. The scale ranges from 0 (no pain) to a maximum of 10 (unbearable pain)

secondary_outcome.measure: Post-operative Pain Scale at 6-7 Hours Post op
secondary_outcome.description: Visual analog score at 6 hours post op will be compared in the two groups. The scale ranges from 0 (no pain) to a maximum of 10 (unbearable pain)

secondary_outcome.measure: Visual Analog Scale for Pain: Pre-operative.
secondary_outcome.description: Participants asked to report on pre-operative level of pain using a Visual Analog Scale. The scale is participant reported and ranges from 0 representing no pain to 10 representing unbearable pain.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Scheduled to undergo mid-urethral sling for incontinence without concomitant procedures
Exclusion Criteria:
- Undergoing procedure in addition to the sling
- Not competent to give consent
- Using intermittent self catheterization pre-operatively
- Known allergy to local anesthetic
- Undergoing spinal anesthesia for the procedure
- Prisoners
- Non-English speaker
- Under 18 years of age
- Has a condition that would contra-indicate the use of local anesthetic or epinephrine

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Subjects with stress incontinence or stress-predominant mixed urinary incontinence who were scheduled to undergo a retropubic midurethral sling with no concomitant procedures at UMass Memorial Healthcare, Inc. Enrollment occurred from March 2012 to June 2015 with study presented and consent sought at time of preoperative appointment.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: 10 participants did not receive allocated intervention--patient-initiated cancellation of surgery. (Saline + Epinephrine n=6, Bupivavane + Epinephrine n=4). Midway through study, indigo carmine became unavailable and surgical team opted for phenazopyridine. Failed to obtain 6-7 hour pain score in 24 out of 80 subjects.

group.title: Saline + Epinephrine
group.description: Sodium chloride + epinephrine: 10ml 0.9% sodium chloride plus 1:200,000 epinephrine

group.title: Saline + Epinephrine
group.description: Sodium chloride + epinephrine: 10ml 0.9% sodium chloride plus 1:200,000 epinephrine

measure.title: Age
measure.population: all subjects were included in the baseline assessments the final numbers in the results section differ due to subject withdrawal or drop out

measure.title: Region of Enrollment
measure.population: 45 randomized to each, number analyzed differs due to participant withdrawal

measure.title: Visual Analog Scale for Pain: Preoperative
measure.description: Participants were asked to report on pre-operative level of pain using a Visual Analog Scale, The scale is participant reported and ranged form 0 representing no pain to 10 representing unbearable pain.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects Who Passed the Voiding Trial After a Midurethral Sling
outcome.description: Study team assessment of whether the use of local anesthetic has any affect on the percentage of patients who pass their post-operative bladder challenge. This is determined by their voided volume and post-void residual.

outcome.title: Post-operative Pain Scores at 2-3 Hours Post op
outcome.description: Visual analog score at 2 hours post op will be compared in the two groups. The scale ranges from 0 (no pain) to a maximum of 10 (unbearable pain)
outcome.population: Please notice that the number of subjects is different because we only analyzed the pain scores from the subjects who were randomized and had the surgery. We also had some missing pain scores

outcome.title: Post-operative Pain Scale at 6-7 Hours Post op
outcome.description: Visual analog score at 6 hours post op will be compared in the two groups. The scale ranges from 0 (no pain) to a maximum of 10 (unbearable pain)
outcome.population: Study team failed to obtain 6-7 hour pain score for 24 out of the 80 participants. The overall number of participants analyzed reflects this occurence.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Failure to obtain 6-7 hour pain score for 24/80 participants. Impact of large preponderance of slings placed by a subrapublic approach. Study not designed to examine the effect of phenazopyridine in study.
